alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Moore; Richmond; Sampson; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:05PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Moore, Scotland, northwestern Sampson, Harnett, southeastern Richmond, Cumberland and Hoke Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms in scotland, Cumberland and Harnett counties moving east northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Laurinburg, Southern Pines, Raeford, Lillington, Fort Bragg, Pinehurst, Dunn, Aberdeen and Angier. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Moore; Richmond; Sampson; Scotland
